citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors).
citations.narrative:
Expired drugs were found in the facility. A bottle of Oxytocin was found with an expiration date of November 2022 and a
bottle of Toltrazuril had an expiration date of January 2023. The use of expired drugs may have reduced effectiveness or
cause harmful effects to the animals. Each dealer shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that
includes the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The facility must
ensure medications and supplements are not expired. Correct by April 25, 2023.

The record of acquisition APHIS Form 7005 is not complete. The APHIS form 7005 did not include the address, the
vehicle license number and State, or the driver’s license number(or photographic identification card for non-drivers issued
by a State) and State of the person from whom a dog was obtained. Accurate and complete records are essential for
proper traceability of the regulated animals by inspectors and for the proper management of the regulated animals at a
facility and those being brokered, acquired, held, and sold.
Each dealer, other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and each exhibitor shall
make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning each dog
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which
is transported, euthanized, sold or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The record shall include any offspring
born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. The licensee must make, keep, and maintain
records which fully and correctly disclose the required information. Correct by May 1, 2023.

The licensee was unable to provide APHIS 7006 disposition records at the time of inspection. The lack of records during
inspections does not allow for proper traceability of the regulated animals by inspectors. Complete records are needed for
proper management of the regulated animals at a facility and those being brokered, acquired, held, and sold.
Each dealer and exhibitor shall use Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of
Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph
(a)(1) of this section. Correct by ensuring the APHIS form 7006 forms are being used for all dispositions. Correct by April
25, 2023

Surfaces are not being maintained on a regular basis. Excessive chew damage is present on surfaces of an enclosure
housing one adult dog. The frame around the door between the indoor/outdoor areas has chew damage. Chew damage
cannot be properly sanitized and can create sharp points that can cause injury to the animals.
An enclosure contains carpet that is in disrepair with frayed edges. The enclosure housing one adult dog and 6 puppies
has a carpet that is torn and damaged. Frayed edges can be injurious to the regulated animal as they could ingest the
material or could cause entrapment.
All surfaces must be maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities—including houses, dens, and other
furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility—that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when
worn or soiled. Correct by ensuring that all surfaces are maintained or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by May 8,
2023.

Enclosures are not protecting animals from injury. Exposed electrical cords for heating pads are in two enclosures both
housing one adult dog and 6 puppies. The dogs have access to the electrical cords and could be injured as they could
chew on the cord, ingest the cord, or become entangled. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that
they protect the dogs from injury. Correct by ensuring that the enclosures protect the animals from injury. Correct by May
1, 2023.

The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs is missing required elements. The PVC does not include
preventative care and treatment plan to maintain healthy and unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and
healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. Basic maintenance and preventative care of all dogs must be included in the PVC to
ensure all animals are being evaluated on a routine basis for potential signs of illness or disease. Animals not receiving
routine preventative care and maintenance are more likely to develop preventable conditions including severe matting and
skin infections, dental disease, overgrown nails, and eye and ear infections. Correct by ensuring the PVC for dogs
addresses the preventative care and treatment of all dogs to ensure healthy and unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed
nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin and teeth. Correct by May 1, 2023.

The licensee was unable to provide documentation for the results of several fecal and heartworm screening tests.
Records indicate that two fecal screening tests and four heartworm screening tests for adult dogs were performed but no
results were found. Failure to document screening test results may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine
if the dogs are receiving adequate veterinary care. Medical records must be maintained and include the dates and
findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended test or examination. Correct by documenting
the results of all testing and ensure that records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by May 1,
2023
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
2.40(b)(2) 
   
Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care (dealers and exhibitors). 
Expired drugs were found in the facility. A bottle of Oxytocin was found with an expiration date of November 2022 and a 
bottle of Toltrazuril had an expiration date of January 2023. The use of expired drugs may have reduced effectiveness or 
cause harmful effects to the animals. Each dealer shall establish and maintain programs of adequate veterinary care that 
includes the use of appropriate methods to prevent, control, diagnose, and treat diseases and injuries. The facility must 
ensure medications and supplements are not expired. Correct by April 25, 2023. 
2.75(a)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The record of acquisition APHIS Form 7005 is not complete. The APHIS form 7005 did not include the address, the 
vehicle license number and State, or the driver’s license number(or photographic identification card for non-drivers issued 
by a State) and State of the person from whom a dog was obtained. Accurate and complete records are essential for 
proper traceability of the regulated animals by inspectors and for the proper management of the regulated animals at a 
facility and those being brokered, acquired, held, and sold.  
 
Each dealer, other than operators of auction sales and brokers to whom animals are consigned, and each exhibitor shall

make, keep, and maintain records or forms which fully and correctly disclose the information concerning each dog 
purchased or otherwise acquired, owned, held, or otherwise in his or her possession or under his or her control, or which 
is transported, euthanized, sold or otherwise disposed of by that dealer or exhibitor. The record shall include any offspring 
born of any animal while in his or her possession or under his or her control. The licensee must make, keep, and maintain 
records which fully and correctly disclose the required information. Correct by May 1, 2023. 
2.75(a)(2) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee was unable to provide APHIS 7006 disposition records at the time of inspection. The lack of records during 
inspections does not allow for proper traceability of the regulated animals by inspectors. Complete records are needed for 
proper management of the regulated animals at a facility and those being brokered, acquired, held, and sold.  
 
Each dealer and exhibitor shall use Record of Acquisition and Dogs and Cats on Hand (APHIS Form 7005) and Record of 
Disposition of Dogs and Cats (APHIS Form 7006) to make, keep, and maintain the information required by paragraph 
(a)(1) of this section. Correct by ensuring the APHIS form 7006 forms are being used for all dispositions. Correct by April 
25, 2023 
3.1(c)(2) 
   
Housing facilities, general. 
Surfaces are not being maintained on a regular basis. Excessive chew damage is present on surfaces of an enclosure 
housing one adult dog. The frame around the door between the indoor/outdoor areas has chew damage. Chew damage 
cannot be properly sanitized and can create sharp points that can cause injury to the animals.  
 
An enclosure contains carpet that is in disrepair with frayed edges. The enclosure housing one adult dog and 6 puppies

has a carpet that is torn and damaged. Frayed edges can be injurious to the regulated animal as they could ingest the 
material or could cause entrapment.  
 
All surfaces must be maintained on a regular basis. Surfaces of housing facilities—including houses, dens, and other 
furniture-type fixtures and objects within the facility—that cannot be readily cleaned and sanitized, must be replaced when 
worn or soiled. Correct by ensuring that all surfaces are maintained or replaced when worn or soiled. Correct by May 8, 
2023. 
3.6(a)(2)(ii) 
   
Primary enclosures. 
Enclosures are not protecting animals from injury. Exposed electrical cords for heating pads are in two enclosures both 
housing one adult dog and 6 puppies. The dogs have access to the electrical cords and could be injured as they could 
chew on the cord, ingest the cord, or become entangled. Primary enclosures must be constructed and maintained so that 
they protect the dogs from injury. Correct by ensuring that the enclosures protect the animals from injury. Correct by May 
1, 2023. 
3.13(a)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC) for dogs is missing required elements. The PVC does not include 
preventative care and treatment plan to maintain healthy and unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed nails, and clean and 
healthy eyes, ears, skin, and teeth. Basic maintenance and preventative care of all dogs must be included in the PVC to 
ensure all animals are being evaluated on a routine basis for potential signs of illness or disease. Animals not receiving 
routine preventative care and maintenance are more likely to develop preventable conditions including severe matting and 
skin infections, dental disease, overgrown nails, and eye and ear infections. Correct by ensuring the PVC for dogs

addresses the preventative care and treatment of all dogs to ensure healthy and unmatted hair coats, properly trimmed 
nails, and clean and healthy eyes, ears, skin and teeth. Correct by May 1, 2023. 
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee was unable to provide documentation for the results of several fecal and heartworm screening tests. 
Records indicate that two fecal screening tests and four heartworm screening tests for adult dogs were performed but no 
results were found. Failure to document screening test results may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine 
if the dogs are receiving adequate veterinary care. Medical records must be maintained and include the dates and 
findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required or recommended test or examination. Correct by documenting 
the results of all testing and ensure that records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by May 1, 
2023 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
